Enable this permission in Setting - Security - Phone administrators Out of trial time Enable accessibility permission Enable/disable Edges by long press home button By set Swiftly Switch to your Assist app (instead of Google Now On Tap), you can enable/disable trigger edges at any time by long press home button. Enable assist app This feature is only available for Android 6.0 and above. For lower Android system, you can enable/disable the Edges from the persistent notification. About Pro version Get the Pro version to:

 - Unlock second Edge

 - Customize column count and row count of Grid Favorite

 - Icon pack support

 - Auto disable Swiftly Switch in full-screen apps About Privacy policy

Backup successfully Please wait Connecting Downloading Uploading The backup file will be stored in your Google Drive. Please connect to your Google account and then choose the folder to upload. Choose the backup file from Google Drive.
Persistent notification is for keeping Swiftly Switch stay in background. Hide it in App Info window.

 If you see the "Screen overlay detected" window when giving permission for other app, please pause Swiftly Switch from the notification

 Or just swipe in from the edge, Swiftly Switch will be paused for 10s automatically when you're in giving permission window.
Pause if you see the "Screen Overlay Detected". Click for more info Swiftly Switch: auto pause for 10s while giving permission. Change this in Swiftly Switch setting. Hide notification Open Swiftly Switch
//FAQs FAQs How to hide the notification? Persistent notification is for keeping Swiftly Switch stay in background but you can hide it by blocking all of the notification from Swiftly Switch in the App Info. To hide it: click to the notification > Hide notification > Block notification.
What is "Screen overlay detected"? This is the security feature of Android 6.0. You'll see this dialog when giving permission to other app while a "Floating app" is running. When this happens, just trigger Swiftly Switch by swipe in from the edge, Swiftly Switch will be automatically paused for 10 seconds so you can give permission to other app as normal. Alternatively, you can pause Swiftly Switch from the Notification and resume when you finish
How to auto disable the app when playing game? Go to More Setting and turn on the "Disable In Fullscreen apps" or "Disable in landscape mode"
Why sometime it take few seconds to launch an app? Swiftly switch can't start apps within 5 seconds from the point you return the Home Screen. This is the how Android limit services. It's not a problem if you return home by the in app Home Shortcut.
Problem on Xiaomi devices On MIUI 7, you need to enable the "Display pop-up" permission to make it work. Go to Setting > Apps > Swiftly switch > Permission > Display pop-up > restart the app. 

On MIUI 8, you need to locking the app in the recent menu and turning off the Background Restriction. To Lock the app in the recent menu: Press the Recent button > Swipe down from the window that indicate Swiftly Switch > Click the Lock icon.

 To turn off the Background restriction: Setting > Battery and performance > Manage apps battery usage > Choose Apps > Swiftly Switch > click to No restrictions.
Problem on Huawei devices Please try to turn on the option for Swiftly Switch in Dropzone Manager. Also turn on the option for Swiftly Switch in "Protected Apps" setting to keep it running in background.
Problem on Oppo devices Please turn off the Deep Clear option in Setting. This will stop all the background process once you exit the app
Why closed app still on recent list? Due to the limitation from Android 5.0, 3rd party app can only access your recent used apps, not which app is currently running on your device.
Why there is no shortcut for switching mobile network or airplane mode? Due to restrictions from Android, Swiftly Switch does not have the authority to directly access and switch your mobile network or airplane mode.
Why I can't uninstall the app on my device? You can uninstall the app as other applications. If you have set the app to "Phone administrator" (for Screen lock shortcut) you'll need to disable it first: Setting > Security > Phone administrator > disable the option for Swiftly Switch).
//What new VERSION 3.0.0.10 (beta):
 - Option to keep Recent apps and Circle Favorite stay on screen (enabled by default) 
 - Delete shortcuts set 
 - Improve rearranging in Grid setting
 - Fix bugs
VERSION 3.0.0.9 (beta):
 - Improve UI 
 - Option to disable Edges in full-screen apps
 - Redesign notification
 - Auto pause for 10 seconds when trigger Edge while giving permission(Android 6.0)
 - FAQs, What new
 - Fix does not show new installed app in recent and other bugs
VERSION 3.0.0.8 (beta):
 - Fix bugs
VERSION 3.0.0.7 (beta):
 - Backup/import data to/from Google Drive 
 - Customize Quick Actions size, visibility
 - Fix vibration duration in More setting
